sentences.sContent: Once I saw an elephant go by.
sentences.sContent_eng: Once I saw an elephant go by.
sentences.sCn: 一次我看见一头大象路过。

sentences.sContent: What is your elephant? How do you deal with it?
sentences.sContent_eng: What is your elephant? How do you deal with it?
sentences.sCn: 你的大象是什么？你会怎么处理它？

sentences.sContent: Once I addressed the elephant, we were able to kick him out of the room.
sentences.sContent_eng: Once I addressed the elephant, we were able to kick him out of the room.
sentences.sCn: 当我承认了这头大象的存在，我们就能够把它从房间里面赶走。

phrases.pCn: 白象，灰色象（在印度、东南亚被视为神圣之物）；无价值的东西

trans.tranOther: a very large grey animal with four legs, two tusks(= long curved teeth ) and a trunk(= long nose ) that it can use to pick things up
